column4: does anyone have a link that explains how to manually add drivers using the console (I may have to add drivers for a wireless card)
it depends on what driver
in this case, it's a driver for a Ralink wireless card attached to a PCI slot
you do you know what chipset specifically?
intel 845
joshwryan i mean ralink chipset
the version of the card is EW-7128g
does that help?
ya hang on ill check for you
the card worked under the desktop version, but not the server version
meaning the desktop version installed automatically, but the server version apparently needs a manual install
thats weird
tell me about it! I actually re-installed a 2nd time thinking something went wrong, but I got the same result
ok you are going to want to download the rt61 hourly at http://rt2x00.serialmonkey.com/wiki/index.php/Downloads
and then when you extract there will be a readme basically you are just gonna want to do a ./configure then make then make install
and if you have problems connecting, on that link there is  a graphical connect utility and you should try that

ok, I will give it a shot...can I ask you another quick question? I want to install GUI under server...I tried sudo apt-install ubuntu-desktop but it said the package did not exist...should I get my internet working first and then download gnome or does it exist under a different name?
id worry about getting it to work first
then worry about connecting
ok, thanks for your help
np. ive done ralink drivers a million times its either gonna go real easy or things are gonna go bad so good luck
